## createStandardPolicy() function

> This API is provided as an alpha preview for developers and may change based on feedback that we receive. Do not use this API in a production environment.
> 

Create a policy with common, pre-configured patterns.

This is a convenience function for quickly creating policies with standard semantic versioning rules.

**Signature:**

```typescript
export declare function createStandardPolicy(name: string, config?: {
    breakingRemovals?: boolean;
    safeAdditions?: boolean;
    deprecations?: boolean;
    typeNarrowing?: boolean;
    defaultReleaseType?: ReleaseType;
}): DSLPolicy;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

name


</td><td>

string


</td><td>

Unique name identifying this policy


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

config


</td><td>

{ breakingRemovals?: boolean; safeAdditions?: boolean; deprecations?: boolean; typeNarrowing?: boolean; defaultReleaseType?: [ReleaseType](./change-detector-core.releasetype.md)<!-- -->; }


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ Configuration object with feature toggles: - `breakingRemovals` - Include rules for breaking removals (default: true) - `safeAdditions` - Include rules for safe additions (default: true) - `deprecations` - Include rules for deprecation handling (default: true) - `typeNarrowing` - Include rules for type changes (default: true) - `defaultReleaseType` - Default release type for unmatched changes (default: 'none')


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

[DSLPolicy](./change-detector-core.dslpolicy.md)

A complete DSLPolicy ready for use

## Example 1


```typescript
const standardPolicy = createStandardPolicy('my-standard-policy', {
  breakingRemovals: true,
  safeAdditions: true,
  deprecations: true,
  typeNarrowing: true,
  defaultReleaseType: 'patch'
})
```

## Example 2

Minimal configuration

```typescript
// Use all defaults
const policy = createStandardPolicy('standard')
```
